name: Software Engineer
description: At Leidos, I am an AWS gov cloud environment administrator responsible for maintaining Kubernetes deployments of development tools used by my team. I also lead the development of CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code solutions, and build procedures to automate our development and test processes for software delivered to the United States Air Force C-sUAS mission. Additionally, I develop Typescript and Java features on product code and test software in the field on production hardware and real devices.

name: Technology Analyst
description: I developed headless web crawlers using containerized JavaScript running in a Chromium browser. With the gathered data, my team and I wrote dynamic SQL procedures to automate data processing and prepare it for client consumption. Furthermore, I contributed to other Angular and Django applications within the company and delivered demonstrations to clients throughout the development cycle.
points: Javascript, Python, SQL, and Typescript development
Dynamic SQL stored procetures and functions

name: B.S Computer Systems Engineering
description: I initially was accepted into the Aeronautical engineering program at RPI but after 2 semesters, I decided to switch my major to Computer Systems Engineering. While a significant portion of my curriculum was focused on electrical engineering topics like electronics and computer hardware design, I opted to enroll in software and programming related elective courses for nearly all of my free electives.
points: C, C++, CUDA, and Python development
CPU and RAM architecture and design

name: M.S Computer Science
description: I decided to pursue a Master's degree in Computer Science to learn more advanced concepts of computer science that were not covered in my electrical engineering focused undergraduate degree. Database design, front-end development, back-end development, and advances programming techniques like containers, libraries were some of the topics covered in this degree program.
points: Machine Learning model training and inference
Full stack web development - MERN stack

name: Machine Learning Term Project
description: In this course, I implemented a machine learning project to predict commercial flight delays. The project was implemented in Python using primarily the scikit-learn library. Stages of the project included data preprocessing, model training, and evaluation of various machine learning algorithms to determine the optimal classification method to solve a real-world problem.

name: React Web Application
description: The goal of this term project was to develop a web application using the React framework using the strategies covered in the course. If you are reading this, you are likely looking at the result of this project which is a /Portfolio/ displaying my professional experience. The project was implemented in JavaScript and uses React, HTML, and CSS to create a responsive and interactive user interface.

name: Unraid Home NAS
description: I first started building out this NAS back in late 2020 with the goal of centralizing my family’s large library of music CDs, photos, and videos we’ve collected over the years to a storage device detached from the cloud. Learning Linux and exploring networking and security were also curiosities of mine at the time. The first iteration of this machine was a simple Linux desktop computer with a couple hard drives accessible to the local network for basic NAS functions. At this point I began exploring running open-source services on the machine to give all of us more reasons to use it. Plex was where I started and I found it fascinating that I could listen to any track of mine anywhere I was on any device. From there, I began to experiment win any application that I thought was remotely useful to build up an impressive fleet of services which leads to the second and current iteration of the machine. Currently today, the system is running Unraid which is a NAS focused OS that has support for several storage array configurations wit redundant protections, docker containers, and KVM virtual machines. I have also expanded the system to a used enterprise server chassis that I found on eBay configured with 20 Xeon CPU cores, 48TB of memory, and a 20TB storage array. The system runs a variety of services including a fully automated Plex stack, Nextcloud, Jellyfin, GitLab, a full Bitcoin node, and more security and networking tools.
points: File system management with ZFS and Btrfs

name: Proxmox Home Server
description: After several years of using Unraid, I decided to add to my home lab a Proxmox server. I chose Proxmox due to a recommendation from a colleague at the time and decided to go after another used enterprise server platform. This time however, I went with a machine containing fewer but faster CPU cores to handle unique workloads that rely on single-threaded performance like game servers for my friends and I. The system has 10 Xeon cores, 128GB of memory and a 2TB drive in it for local storage. I run all of the game servers on the local disk for better performance but back them up over the network to my NAS machine for safe redundant storage. Today, the machine runs nearly 10 game server instances and is holding up strong.

name: GPU Server Project
description: My latest expedition into home servers was building a system for handling GPU workloads. Initially, I used this server to run cryptocurrency mining and validation applications to explore blockchain technology but I have since shut that down to preserve my hardware for other appealing applications like local machine learning and AI applications. Although I have not gotten to this point yet, I think it would be very cool to have my own private instances of some open-source models to enhance my personal productivity whether its writing code, generating text or images, or any other creative outlet.

name: Unreal Engine 5 Multiplayer Game
description: I started exploring the Unreal Engine 5 game engine for its impressive capabilities and becasue of my general interest in video games. I went through a Udemy course on UE4 game development a few years ago and am now getting back into it with a course on UE5. I find the technology interesting and believe that Unreal Engine has broad applications across the software space including data visualization, film, and even augmented reality training simulations.
